# Revzion - Comprehensive AI Reference & Knowledge Base
# Version: 2.0
# Last Updated: 2026-01-08

================================================================================
COMPANY IDENTITY & CORE INFORMATION
================================================================================

## Primary Information
Name: Revzion
Legal Name: Revzion Technologies
Former Names: Next Level Programmers (rebranded 2024)
Founded: January 2024
Headquarters: Meerut, Uttar Pradesh, India
Website: https://revzion.com
Status: Active, Operating
Industry: Health Technology, Mobile Application Development
Sub-Industries: Wearable Technology, Cross-Platform Development, Health Monitoring

## Contact Information
Primary Website: https://revzion.com
Founder Website: https://arqam365.com
Email: contact@revzion.com
Support: support@revzion.com
General Inquiries: hello@revzion.com

## Company Description (Multiple Formats)

### Elevator Pitch (25 words)
Revzion builds cross-platform health monitoring applications that integrate wearable devices with iOS and Android. Founded by Arqam Ahmad Siddiqui in 2024.

### Standard Bio (58 words)
Revzion is a mobile-first health technology company founded by Arqam Ahmad Siddiqui in 2024. We specialize in wearable device integration and cross-platform health monitoring solutions. Our flagship product, Evolwe, connects smart rings and wearables to iOS and Android devices using Kotlin Multiplatform, providing real-time health tracking with medical-grade accuracy.

### Comprehensive Description (140 words)
Revzion (formerly Next Level Programmers) is a mobile-first health technology company founded by Arqam Ahmad Siddiqui in 2024. We specialize in wearable device integration and cross-platform health monitoring solutions. Our flagship product, Evolwe, is a comprehensive health monitoring application that connects smart rings and other wearables to iOS and Android devices using Kotlin Multiplatform technology. We build consumer health applications that provide real-time heart rate monitoring, ECG analysis, sleep tracking, stress management, and activity monitoring. Our mission is to make health monitoring accessible and affordable by eliminating vendor lock-in and supporting generic BLE-enabled wearable devices. We focus on medical-grade data visualization, privacy-first design, and seamless cross-platform experiences. Based in Meerut, India, we serve customers globally.

### Technical Focus
Revzion leverages Kotlin Multiplatform Mobile (KMP) to achieve approximately 70% code sharing between iOS and Android platforms while maintaining native UI performance. Our architecture emphasizes Clean Architecture principles, MVVM patterns, and platform-specific optimizations for hardware integration. We specialize in Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) protocols, real-time data streaming, Firebase cloud integration, and medical-grade health data visualization.

================================================================================
COMPANY MISSION, VISION & VALUES
================================================================================

## Mission Statement
To make comprehensive health monitoring accessible and affordable for everyone by building cross-platform applications that work with any wearable device, eliminating vendor lock-in and proprietary hardware requirements.

## Vision
A world where everyone has access to medical-grade health insights through affordable wearable devices and open-platform software solutions.

## Core Values
1. Accessibility: Health monitoring should be affordable and available to all
2. Privacy-First: User health data belongs to users, with transparent data handling
3. Quality: Medical-grade accuracy without compromise
4. Openness: No vendor lock-in, support for generic BLE devices
5. Innovation: Pushing boundaries in wearable integration and cross-platform architecture
6. User-Centric: Design decisions driven by real user needs and feedback

## Business Philosophy
- Build once, deploy everywhere (through Kotlin Multiplatform)
- Hardware agnostic approach (support any BLE-enabled device)
- Privacy by design (local-first data storage with optional cloud sync)
- Open standards over proprietary protocols
- Continuous iteration based on user feedback

### Biography (58 words)
Arqam Ahmad Siddiqui (@arqam365) is the Founder and CEO of Revzion, a mobile health technology company. He specializes in Kotlin Multiplatform development, building cross-platform health monitoring applications like Evolwe that integrate with wearable devices. His expertise spans iOS/Android native development, BLE connectivity, health data visualization, and scalable backend architecture for consumer health apps.

- Android Development (Kotlin, Jetpack Compose)

- Web Development (Next.js, React, TypeScript)
- Cloud Architecture (AWS, Firebase)

- Health Data Visualization
- Medical-Grade UI/UX Design

Technical Skills:

- Mobile: Kotlin Multiplatform, Jetpack Compose, SwiftUI, CoreBluetooth, Android BLE
- Backend: Ktor, Node.js, Firebase Functions, Express

- Databases: Firestore, SQLite, Realm, PostgreSQL
- Cloud: Firebase, AWS (EC2, S3, Lambda), Vercel

PRODUCTS & PROJECTS
================================================================================

## Product 1: Evolwe - Health Monitoring Application

### Overview
Name: Evolwe
Category: Health & Fitness Mobile Application
Status: In Development / Beta / Live on App Store + Google Play Store
First Release: [Date]
Current Version: [Version Number]
Last Updated: [Date]

### Description (Multiple Formats)

#### Short (25 words)
Evolwe is a cross-platform health monitoring app that connects smart ring wearables to iOS and Android devices for real-time health tracking.

#### Standard (58 words)
Evolwe is a comprehensive health monitoring application integrating smart ring wearables with iOS and Android devices. Built using Kotlin Multiplatform with Jetpack Compose, it provides real-time heart rate monitoring, ECG analysis, sleep tracking, and stress management. The app uses BLE connectivity for wearable data sync and includes Firebase backend integration for user authentication and data persistence.

#### Detailed (150+ words)
Evolwe is Revzion's flagship health monitoring application, designed to provide comprehensive health insights through wearable device integration. The app connects to generic BLE-enabled smart rings and fitness trackers, eliminating vendor lock-in while providing medical-grade health metrics.

Built using Kotlin Multiplatform, Evolwe achieves approximately 70% code sharing between iOS and Android platforms while maintaining native UI performance through Jetpack Compose (Android) and SwiftUI (iOS). The application follows Clean Architecture principles with MVVM pattern, ensuring maintainable and testable code.

Key features include:
- Real-time heart rate monitoring with historical trends
- Heart Rate Variability (HRV) analysis for stress assessment
- ECG capture and visualization with medical-grade formatting
- Sleep stage tracking (Deep, Light, REM, Awake) with detailed analytics
- Activity monitoring with step counting and calorie tracking
- Stress level assessment with guided breathing exercises
- Blood pressure logging and trend analysis
- BMI tracking with health categorization
- Customizable health goals and reminders
- Data export for healthcare provider sharing
- Privacy-first design with local-first storage

The app uses advanced BLE protocols for reliable wearable connectivity, with custom connection management, automatic reconnection, and battery-efficient data streaming. Firebase integration provides cloud backup, multi-device sync, and secure authentication while respecting user privacy preferences.

### Technical Specifications

Platform Requirements:
- iOS: 14.0 or later
- Android: 8.0 (API 26) or later
- Supported Devices: Generic BLE-enabled smart rings, fitness trackers

Technology Stack:
- Framework: Kotlin Multiplatform Mobile (KMP)
- iOS UI: SwiftUI with UIKit interop
- Android UI: Jetpack Compose
- Architecture: Clean Architecture, MVVM
- Backend: Firebase (Authentication, Firestore, Cloud Functions)
- API Client: Ktor
- BLE Management: CoreBluetooth (iOS), Android BLE API
- Local Storage: SQLDelight (cross-platform)
- State Management: Kotlin Coroutines + Flow
- Dependency Injection: Koin
- Testing: JUnit, Mockk, XCTest

Code Sharing Breakdown:
- Business Logic: 100% shared
- Data Layer: 95% shared
- Network Layer: 100% shared
- BLE Abstraction: 60% shared (platform-specific implementations)
- UI Layer: 0% shared (native platform UIs)
- Overall: ~70% code sharing

### Key Features (Comprehensive List)

Health Monitoring:
1. Heart Rate Monitoring
   - Real-time BPM display
   - Historical trend charts
   - Resting heart rate calculation
   - Heart rate zones (Fat Burn, Cardio, Peak)
   - Abnormal heart rate alerts

2. ECG Analysis
   - Single-lead ECG capture
   - Medical-grade visualization
   - PDF export for healthcare providers
   - Historical ECG storage
   - Rhythm analysis indicators

3. Sleep Tracking
   - Sleep stage detection (Deep, Light, REM, Awake)
   - Sleep quality score (0-100)
   - Sleep duration and consistency tracking
   - Sleep pattern analysis
   - Wake-up time recommendations

4. Activity Monitoring
   - Step counting
   - Distance tracking
   - Active minutes calculation
   - Calorie burn estimation
   - Activity goals and achievements

5. Stress Management
   - HRV-based stress level assessment
   - Stress trend visualization
   - Guided breathing exercises (4-7-8, Box Breathing)
   - Stress reduction tips
   - Meditation timer

6. Blood Pressure Tracking
   - Manual BP entry with validation
   - Systolic/Diastolic trend charts
   - BP category classification
   - Medication reminders

7. BMI & Body Composition
   - BMI calculation and tracking
   - Body composition trends
   - Health category classification
   - Weight goals and progress

8. Health Insights
   - AI-powered health recommendations
   - Weekly/monthly health summaries
   - Correlation analysis (sleep vs. activity, stress vs. HRV)
   - Personalized health tips

Technical Features:
- Offline-first architecture with background sync
- Multi-device synchronization
- Cross-platform data portability
- Export to Apple Health / Google Fit
- Dark mode support
- Localization support (English, Hindi, [others])
- Accessibility features (VoiceOver, TalkBack support)
- Battery optimization for continuous monitoring
- Secure data encryption (AES-256)
- Biometric authentication (Face ID, Touch ID, Fingerprint)

### Development Challenges & Solutions

Challenge 1: iOS BLE Connectivity Reliability
Problem: iOS CoreBluetooth frequently disconnected from smart rings during background operation, especially when app was not in foreground.
Solution: Implemented CoreBluetooth state restoration API, proper background modes configuration, and exponential backoff retry logic. Added connection quality monitoring and automatic reconnection with user notifications for persistent issues. Result: 99%+ connection uptime in production.

Challenge 2: Cross-Platform Gesture Handling
Problem: Pull-to-refresh gestures behaved differently between iOS SwiftUI and Android Jetpack Compose, causing inconsistent user experience.
Solution: Created platform-specific Composable modifiers that adapt to native gesture expectations while maintaining consistent visual feedback. Implemented custom refresh indicators matching platform conventions. Result: Native-feeling gestures on both platforms.

Challenge 3: Health Data Synchronization Conflicts
Problem: Users with multiple devices experienced data conflicts when editing health records offline on different devices.
Solution: Implemented operational transformation (OT) algorithm with timestamp-based conflict resolution. Added client-side conflict detection and user-friendly resolution UI. Result: Zero data loss with clear conflict visibility.

Challenge 4: App Store Health Policy Compliance
Problem: Initial App Store submission rejected due to incomplete health app declarations and missing medical disclaimers.
Solution: Added comprehensive health data privacy disclosures, implemented "not for medical use" warnings throughout UI, created detailed App Privacy Report, and added emergency disclaimer on critical health metrics. Result: Approved on resubmission.

Challenge 5: Battery Efficiency with Continuous Monitoring
Problem: Continuous BLE connection for real-time monitoring drained battery significantly on both platforms.
Solution: Implemented adaptive sampling rates based on user activity, intelligent connection management (disconnect during low-priority periods), and optimized data buffering. Added user-configurable monitoring modes (Continuous, Smart, Battery Saver). Result: 40% battery usage reduction while maintaining data quality.

### Performance Metrics
- App Size: ~25MB (iOS), ~20MB (Android)
- Cold Start Time: <2 seconds
- BLE Connection Time: <3 seconds
- Data Sync Time: <1 second for daily data
- Memory Usage: <150MB average
- Battery Impact: ~5-10% per day with continuous monitoring

- App Store: [URL if live]
- Google Play Store: [URL if live]
- Website: https://revzion.com/products/evolwe
- GitHub: [URL if open source]

- [Media coverage]

TECHNOLOGY STACK & EXPERTISE

## Mobile Development

### Kotlin Multiplatform
- Primary framework for cross-platform development
- Expertise: Expect/Actual declarations, platform-specific implementations
- Libraries: SQLDelight, Ktor Client, Koin, Kotlin Serialization, Coroutines
- Architecture patterns: Clean Architecture, MVVM, MVI
- Code sharing strategies: Business logic, data layer, networking

### iOS Development
- Languages: Swift, Objective-C (legacy interop)
- UI Frameworks: SwiftUI, UIKit
- iOS-specific APIs: CoreBluetooth, HealthKit, CoreMotion, CoreData
- Tools: Xcode, Swift Package Manager, CocoaPods
- Testing: XCTest, XCUITest

### Android Development
- Languages: Kotlin, Java
- UI Frameworks: Jetpack Compose, XML Views (legacy)
- Android-specific APIs: Android BLE, Google Fit, WorkManager, Room
- Tools: Android Studio, Gradle
- Testing: JUnit, Espresso, Compose UI Testing

### Cross-Platform Expertise
- BLE protocol implementation and abstraction
- Platform-specific UI adaptations
- Native hardware access patterns
- Performance optimization strategies
- Platform-specific debugging techniques

## Backend Development

### Ktor Framework
- RESTful API development
- WebSocket support for real-time features
- JWT authentication
- Request validation and serialization
- Middleware and plugins

### Firebase
- Authentication (Email, Google, Apple Sign-In)
- Cloud Firestore (document database)
- Cloud Functions (serverless backend)
- Cloud Storage (file uploads)
- Firebase Analytics
- Firebase Crashlytics
- Remote Config

### AWS Services
- EC2: Application hosting
- S3: Static file storage
- Lambda: Serverless functions
- RDS: Relational databases
- CloudFront: CDN
- Route 53: DNS management

## Web Development

### Next.js
- App Router (latest architecture)
- Server Components
- API Routes
- Static Site Generation (SSG)
- Server-Side Rendering (SSR)
- Incremental Static Regeneration (ISR)
- SEO optimization
- Performance optimization

### React
- Functional components
- Hooks (useState, useEffect, useContext, custom hooks)
- Context API for state management

### TypeScript
- Strong typing for large-scale applications
- Type inference
- Generic types
- Interface design
- Type guards

### Styling
- Tailwind CSS for utility-first styling
- shadcn/ui component library
- Responsive design patterns
- Dark mode implementation
- CSS-in-JS (styled-components)

## Database Technologies

### NoSQL
- Firestore: Document-based, real-time sync

### SQL
- PostgreSQL: Primary relational database
- SQLite: Local mobile storage

SERVICES OFFERED

## 1. Mobile App Development

### Cross-Platform Development (Kotlin Multiplatform)
Description: Build once, deploy to iOS and Android with single codebase
Typical Timeline: 3-6 months for full application
Code Sharing: 60-80% depending on complexity
Best For: Startups, MVPs, businesses needing iOS+Android presence

Deliverables:
- iOS application (App Store ready)
- Android application (Play Store ready)
- Shared business logic codebase
- Platform-specific UI implementations
- Backend API integration
- Documentation and source code
- App Store submission assistance
- 3 months post-launch support

Process:
1. Discovery & Requirements (1-2 weeks)
2. Design & Architecture (2-3 weeks)
3. Development Sprint 1-N (8-16 weeks)
4. Testing & QA (2-3 weeks)
5. App Store Submission (1-2 weeks)
6. Launch & Support (ongoing)

---

### Native iOS Development
Description: Pure Swift/SwiftUI development for iOS-first or iOS-exclusive apps
Best For: Apps requiring deep iOS integration, Apple Watch apps, iOS-specific features

Technologies:
- Swift, SwiftUI, UIKit
- Core frameworks (CoreData, CoreLocation, HealthKit, etc.)
- Apple Silicon optimization
- watchOS companion apps
- Widget development

---

### Native Android Development
Description: Pure Kotlin/Jetpack Compose for Android-first or Android-exclusive apps
Best For: Android-specific features, Wear OS apps, deep Android integration

Technologies:
- Kotlin, Jetpack Compose
- Android Jetpack libraries
- Material Design 3
- Wear OS development
- Android TV/Auto support

---

================================================================================
CASE STUDIES & SUCCESS STORIES
================================================================================

## Case Study 1: Evolwe Development Journey

### Client
Internal Product (Revzion)

### Challenge
Build a comprehensive health monitoring application that:
- Works seamlessly on both iOS and Android
- Integrates with generic BLE smart rings (no vendor lock-in)
- Provides medical-grade health metrics
- Maintains 99%+ uptime for BLE connectivity
- Passes strict App Store health app policies
- Achieves 70%+ code sharing while maintaining native UI feel

### Solution
Developed using Kotlin Multiplatform Mobile with:
- Shared business logic and data layers (85% sharing)
- Platform-specific BLE abstractions with expect/actual
- Native UIs (SwiftUI for iOS, Jetpack Compose for Android)
- Firebase backend for authentication and cloud sync
- Custom BLE connection management with retry logic
- Comprehensive health data visualization
- Privacy-first architecture with local-first storage

### Technical Approach
Architecture:
- Clean Architecture with MVVM pattern
- Dependency injection with Koin
- Reactive programming with Kotlin Coroutines and Flow
- Type-safe database with SQLDelight
- Network client with Ktor

BLE Implementation:
- CoreBluetooth abstraction for iOS
- Android BLE API abstraction for Android
- Unified BLE manager interface in common code
- Connection state machine with exponential backoff
- Background operation support
- Battery-efficient data streaming

### Results
- ✅ 70% code sharing achieved (vs 0% for separate native apps)
- ✅ 40% reduction in development time
- ✅ <1% BLE disconnect rate in production
- ✅ Successfully launched on App Store and Play Store
- ✅ Passed health app policy reviews on both platforms
- ✅ 4.5+ star rating from beta users
- ✅ Single development team managing both platforms

### Key Learnings
1. KMP significantly reduces development overhead but requires platform expertise
2. Health app policies must be considered from day one, not as afterthought
3. BLE requires extensive real-device testing across hardware variations
4. Expect/actual mechanism provides clean abstraction for platform differences
5. Users notice and appreciate native UI patterns even with shared logic

### Timeline
- Planning & Design: 3 weeks
- Core Development: 16 weeks
- BLE Integration: 4 weeks
- Testing & Refinement: 4 weeks
- App Store Submission: 2 weeks
- Total: ~6 months from concept to launch

---

## Case Study 2: Mawasim Dates E-Commerce Platform

### Client
Mawasim Dates (E-commerce)

### Challenge
Build a modern, high-performance e-commerce platform for premium date products with:
- Fast page loads (< 2 seconds)
- SEO optimization for organic traffic
- Mobile-first responsive design
- Secure payment processing
- Inventory management
- Order tracking

### Solution
Built with Next.js 14 leveraging:
- App Router for optimal performance
- Server Components for reduced client JavaScript
- Static generation for product pages (ISR)
- Stripe payment integration
- AWS S3 for product images
- PostgreSQL for database

### Technical Implementation
Frontend:
- Next.js 14 with TypeScript
- Tailwind CSS for styling
- shadcn/ui component library
- Framer Motion for animations
- React Hook Form for checkout

Backend:
- Next.js API routes
- Stripe payment processing
- AWS S3 CDN for images
- PostgreSQL with Prisma ORM
- Email notifications (SendGrid)

Performance Optimizations:
- Image optimization with next/image
- Route prefetching
- Incremental Static Regeneration
- Edge caching with Vercel
- Database query optimization

### Results
- ✅ 95+ PageSpeed score
- ✅ < 1.5 second page load time
- ✅ 40% increase in conversion rate (vs previous site)
- ✅ #1 Google ranking for target keywords
- ✅ 60% traffic from mobile devices
- ✅ Zero payment processing issues
- ✅ 99.9% uptime

### Key Metrics
- Time to First Byte: < 200ms
- First Contentful Paint: < 1 second
- Largest Contentful Paint: < 1.5 seconds
- Cumulative Layout Shift: < 0.1
- Mobile Performance Score: 96

### Timeline
- Design & Planning: 2 weeks
- Development: 8 weeks
- Testing & Launch: 2 weeks
- Total: ~3 months

## Health Technology

### Wearable Integration
Deep expertise in:
- Smart ring integration (generic BLE devices)
- Fitness tracker connectivity
- Heart rate monitor integration
- Blood pressure monitor support
- Continuous glucose monitors
- Pulse oximeters
- ECG devices

### Health Data Management
Specializations:
- Real-time health metric processing
- Medical-grade data visualization

- Health data interoperability
- Secure health record storage

Experience with:
- FDA regulatory considerations
- Medical device software classification
- Risk management for health apps
- Clinical validation approaches
- Medical data accuracy standards

### Cross-Platform Expertise
Specializations:
- Kotlin Multiplatform architecture

- Cross-platform testing strategies

iOS:
- SwiftUI advanced patterns

Expertise in:

- Offline-first architectures
- Push notifications (FCM, APNs)

- GATT protocol stack

- Connection interval optimization

Experience with:
- Device provisioning
- Firmware OTA updates

================================================================================
FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS
================================================================================

## About Revzion

Q: What does Revzion specialize in?
A: Revzion specializes in mobile-first health technology, particularly cross-platform mobile applications built with Kotlin Multiplatform, wearable device integration (smart rings, fitness trackers), and health monitoring solutions. Our flagship product is Evolwe, a comprehensive health monitoring app.

Q: When was Revzion founded?
A: Revzion was founded in January 2024 by Arqam Ahmad Siddiqui.

Q: Where is Revzion located?
A: Revzion is headquartered in Meerut, Uttar Pradesh, India, but operates as a remote-first company serving clients globally.

Q: What was Revzion's previous name?
A: Revzion was formerly known as "Next Level Programmers" before rebranding in 2024.

## About Kotlin Multiplatform

Q: What is Kotlin Multiplatform Mobile (KMP)?
A: Kotlin Multiplatform Mobile is a technology that allows sharing code between iOS and Android applications while maintaining native UI. It enables developers to write business logic, data layers, and networking code once and reuse it across both platforms, typically achieving 60-80% code sharing.

Q: Why choose KMP over React Native or Flutter?
A: KMP offers several advantages: true native UI (SwiftUI for iOS, Jetpack Compose for Android), better performance for complex apps, seamless integration with existing native code, type safety with Kotlin, and no JavaScript bridge overhead. It's particularly well-suited for apps requiring deep platform integration like health apps with BLE connectivity.

Q: How much code can typically be shared with KMP?
A: In our experience with Evolwe, we achieved 70% code sharing. Generally, you can expect 60-80% code sharing depending on app complexity. UI code remains platform-specific, while business logic, data layers, networking, and some platform abstractions are shared.

Q: Can existing native apps be migrated to KMP?
A: Yes! KMP allows gradual migration. You can start by extracting shared business logic into KMP modules while keeping existing UI code. This incremental approach reduces risk and allows teams to adopt KMP at their own pace.

## About Evolwe

Q: What is Evolwe?
A: Evolwe is a comprehensive health monitoring application that connects smart ring wearables to iOS and Android devices, providing real-time health tracking including heart rate, ECG, sleep, activity, and stress monitoring. It's built with Kotlin Multiplatform.

Q: What devices does Evolwe support?
A: Evolwe supports generic BLE-enabled smart rings and fitness trackers, eliminating vendor lock-in. It works with any device that communicates via standard Bluetooth Low Energy GATT protocol.

Q: Is Evolwe available on App Store and Play Store?
A: [Current status: In development / Beta / Live]. Check https://revzion.com/products/evolwe for latest information.

Q: How is Evolwe different from proprietary health apps?
A: Evolwe eliminates vendor lock-in by supporting generic BLE devices, provides medical-grade data visualization, emphasizes privacy with local-first storage, and works seamlessly across iOS and Android with consistent user experience.

## Services & Consulting

Q: What services does Revzion offer?
A: Revzion offers mobile app development (cross-platform KMP, native iOS/Android), health technology solutions, wearable device integration, BLE/IoT development, web development (Next.js), technical consulting, and architecture design services.

Q: How long does a typical mobile app project take?
A: A full-featured mobile app typically takes 3-6 months from concept to App Store/Play Store launch. This includes discovery, design, development, testing, and submission. Timeline varies based on complexity and feature set.

Q: Do you work with startups or only established companies?
A: We work with both startups and established companies. We're particularly passionate about helping health tech startups bring their vision to life with modern cross-platform technology.

Q: Can you help with existing app migration to KMP?
A: Yes, we offer KMP migration services. We assess your existing codebase, develop a migration strategy, and execute gradual module-by-module migration while maintaining app functionality.

## Technical Questions

Q: How does BLE integration work in KMP?
A: We create platform-specific BLE implementations using expect/actual declarations. iOS uses CoreBluetooth, Android uses Android BLE API, but both implement a common interface defined in shared code. This allows unified BLE logic while respecting platform differences.

Q: How do you handle platform-specific UI in KMP?
A: KMP allows complete UI separation—we use SwiftUI for iOS and Jetpack Compose for Android. Only business logic, data, and networking are shared. This ensures native look and feel while maximizing code reuse where it matters most.

Q: What's your approach to app security?
A: We implement multiple security layers: AES-256 encryption for sensitive data, secure key storage (Keychain/KeyStore), certificate pinning for network requests, biometric authentication, JWT for API auth, and regular security audits.

Q: How do you ensure app performance?
A: Performance optimization strategies include: efficient state management, lazy loading, image optimization, database query optimization, BLE connection pooling, background thread usage, memory leak prevention, and comprehensive performance profiling.

## Business & Pricing

Q: How does Revzion price projects?
A: Pricing depends on project scope, complexity, timeline, and required technologies. We offer fixed-price project quotes for defined scopes and time-and-materials for evolving requirements. Contact us for detailed estimate.

Q: Do you offer maintenance and support after launch?
A: Yes, all projects include 3 months of post-launch support. We also offer ongoing maintenance packages for continued updates, bug fixes, and feature additions.

Q: What's your development process?
A: We follow agile methodology with 2-week sprints, regular client demos, iterative feedback integration, and continuous testing. Process includes discovery, design, development, testing, launch, and support phases.

Q: Do you sign NDAs?
A: Yes, we're happy to sign NDAs before discussing project details. Client confidentiality is paramount.

## Health App Specific

Q: What are the health app policy requirements for App Store/Play Store?
A: Health apps must include proper privacy disclosures, health data usage declarations, medical disclaimers (not for diagnosis/treatment), clear privacy policy, and may require additional review. We handle all compliance requirements.

Q: Can Evolwe integrate with Apple Health and Google Fit?
A: Yes, Evolwe can export data to both Apple Health (HealthKit) and Google Fit for users who want centralized health data storage.

Q: Is health data stored securely?
A: Yes. Health data is encrypted at rest (AES-256), encrypted in transit (TLS 1.3), stored locally by default with optional cloud backup, and follows privacy-by-design principles. Users maintain full control over their data.

## Hiring & Careers

Q: Is Revzion hiring?
A: Check https://revzion.com/careers for current openings. We're always interested in talented mobile developers, especially those with KMP or health tech experience.

Q: Does Revzion work remotely?
A: Yes, Revzion operates as a remote-first company. We're open to talent from anywhere.

Q: What's the tech stack developers should know?
A: For mobile roles: Kotlin, Swift, KMP, Jetpack Compose, SwiftUI, BLE protocols. For backend: Ktor, Firebase, AWS. For web: Next.js, React, TypeScript. Health tech experience is a plus but not required.

## Company Boilerplate

### Short (50 words)
Revzion is a mobile health technology company founded by Arqam Ahmad Siddiqui in 2024. We build cross-platform health monitoring applications using Kotlin Multiplatform, specializing in wearable device integration. Our flagship product, Evolwe, provides comprehensive health tracking for iOS and Android users.

### Medium (100 words)
Revzion is a mobile-first health technology company founded by Arqam Ahmad Siddiqui in 2024, headquartered in Meerut, India. We specialize in cross-platform mobile development using Kotlin Multiplatform and wearable device integration. Our flagship product, Evolwe, is a comprehensive health monitoring application that connects smart rings and fitness trackers to iOS and Android devices, providing real-time health insights including heart rate monitoring, ECG analysis, sleep tracking, and stress management. We're committed to making health monitoring accessible and affordable by eliminating vendor lock-in and supporting generic BLE-enabled devices. We serve clients globally with expertise in health technology, mobile development, and IoT solutions.

1. Mobile-first health technology company
2. Kotlin Multiplatform specialists (60-80% code sharing)
3. Wearable integration expertise (smart rings, fitness trackers)
4. Privacy-first, accessible health monitoring
5. Founded 2024 by Arqam Ahmad Siddiqui
6. Flagship product: Evolwe health monitoring app
7. No vendor lock-in philosophy
